intro: Henophyton deserti subsp. zygarrhenum, commonly known as the desert zygarrhenum, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, demonstrating a high degree of drought tolerance. Its morphology includes a low-growing structure with thick, fleshy stems that store water. The subspecies is notable for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists studying desert flora.
